citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
The facility has a program of Veterinary Care but has not completed the regularly scheduled visits to the premises of the
dealer or exhibitor by the veterinarian. Regularly scheduled visits to the premises allow the attending veterinarian or their
designated veterinarian to evaluate the adequate program of veterinary care and oversee the adequacy of other aspects
of animal care and use.

In the Swainsons Hawk & American Kestrel enclosures, the walls were plywood/particleboard that is not sealed and
therefore is unable to be effectively cleaned and sanitized. Primary enclosures must be constructed and maintained so
that all surfaces in contact with the birds may be readily cleaned and/or sanitized in accordance with 3.158 or be replaced
when worn or soiled.
This inspection was a site approval inspection.
This site is not ready for approval to conduct activity covered under your current Animal Welfare Act License.
Conducting regulated activities at a non-approved site is a violation of the Animal Welfare Act.
Please contact your inspector to schedule your next new site approval inspection.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
n

narrative:
2.40(a) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
The facility has a program of Veterinary Care but has not completed the regularly scheduled visits to the premises of the 
dealer or exhibitor by the veterinarian. Regularly scheduled visits to the premises allow the attending veterinarian or their 
designated veterinarian to evaluate the adequate program of veterinary care and oversee the adequacy of other aspects 
of animal care and use. 
3.153(a)(1)(ix) 
   
Primary enclosures. 
In the Swainsons Hawk & American Kestrel enclosures, the walls were plywood/particleboard that is not sealed and 
therefore is unable to be effectively cleaned and sanitized. Primary enclosures must be constructed and maintained so 
that all surfaces in contact with the birds may be readily cleaned and/or sanitized in accordance with 3.158 or be replaced 
when worn or soiled. 
 
This inspection was a site approval inspection. 
 
This site is not ready for approval to conduct activity covered under your current Animal Welfare Act License. 
 
Conducting regulated activities at a non-approved site is a violation of the Animal Welfare Act. 
 
Please contact your inspector to schedule your next new site approval inspection. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives. 
 
 n
